elements.title: Monument to the Founders of Kyiv (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after being made of reinforced concrete to conform with orders from the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, the Monument to the Founders of Kyiv (depicted) partially collapsed?

elements.title: Fuccbois (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fuccbois' crew won awards, while Fuccboi's prose received both praise and criticism?

elements.title: Peter Strausfeld (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after fleeing the Nazis in 1938, Peter Strausfeld befriended the manager of London's top art house cinema and designed their posters until his death in 1980?

elements.title: Done Somebody Wrong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Allman Brothers Band's well-known 1971 interpretation of "Done Somebody Wrong" had four songwriters listed in the credits, but not Eddie Kirkland, who wrote the original song?

elements.title: Imam Munandar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Imam Munandar once proposed releasing prisoners to kill them?

elements.title: third Onondaga County Courthouse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although the third Onondaga County Courthouse was demolished in 1967, the hand-cut stones of its tower have been preserved?

elements.title: King Albert Park MRT station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that King Albert Park MRT station and its adjoining stations Tan Kah Kee and Sixth Avenue are intended to represent the natural elements?

elements.title: Aaron Stark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aaron Stark's life may have been saved by a friend inviting him in for a blueberry-peach pie?
